column4: i want my alert not to show command alert --icon=Path\my\Icon "My Message"                when it pop up on Screen ... Can any one help me
notify-send -i /home/willis/.config/cairo-dock/themes/MeeGo/icons/gedit.png "Demonstration"
dosent show the command it ran here...
http://www.barregren.se/blog/pop-notification-command-line
also seems to be some built in icons...
notify-send -i face-cool "I'm cool."
: cool
seems you can use any of the default gnome themes icons without needing to use the full path.
: yup !    and thanks you man ... You are great
its the alert alias that you are using - that seems to be causing the issue. due to how bash is parseing the alias
:  i need one more help
: how to add password in your bash Script when you working on same machine
not sure what you mean by adding a password.
: i want to password for my sudo

if the script needs sudo rights, then it should ask for the password as part of the script. or you should run  the script with sudo. you do NOT put a password IN a script. thats security 101 basics. ;)
if the script is running specific commands that need sudo rights. you can set up the sudoers file where sudo's password is not needed for specific commands.
: ok !
: hey is there any system file which can i edit to connect with net setter (USB internet )
: i don't want to connect my net setter using ubuntu API "network Connection"
never heard of 'net setter' so no idea. I just use the normal network manager stuff on my home lans.
: net setter is like mobile broadband
never used it. Other then basic phone teathering, I only use my home network.
: Ok !  thanks you very much .... you saved my day .....and bye bye
